subject: p10268877
raw_hist: -year-old man with 30 seconds of the chest compression, gram-negative rods in sputum, evaluate for broken ribs status post chest compression.
raw_find: A hazy opacity is present in the right lung which may represent aspiration, pleural effusion or hemorrhage. Retrocardiac opacity at the left base is unchanged. Moderate cardiomegaly is stable. Slight prominence of the pulmonary vasculature with cephalization and enlarged pulmonary arteries are consistent with mild pulmonary edema. Tracheostomy tube is in place. There are no displaced rib fractures.
raw_impr: Hazy opacity in the right lung which may represent aspiration versus pleural effusion or hemorrhage. Mild pulmonary edema. No displaced rib fractures.
